section.title: What is Jetty?
section.para: Jetty is an open-source project providing an HTTP server, HTTP client, and javax.servlet container. This Jetty Wiki provides information about getting started with Jetty, basic configuration, specific features, optimization, security, JavaEE, monitoring, FAQs, help with troubleshooting, and more. It includes tutorials, howtos, videos, feature descriptions, and reference materials.

section.title: Proposed Usage
section.para: By following some simple conventions we can make sure that this is a fairly easy and straight forward effort to port our documentation into the new system.

listitem.para: raw content comes from a variety of locations:
the existing wiki until all documentation is ported
developers can checkout the git project make simple changes to any content, coordinating with Shirley as needed to avoid clashes of effort
new 'sections' go here and are written in by developers, this is new features, etc
once new section is ready, work with shirley on where it will go and how it will be wired up
we can all edit and update existing documentation, but new content enters through incoming with shirley as the gatekeeper
We have a way of injecting properties into these xml files. We will leverage that and update the pom.xml and set the version numbers, 6, 7 and 8 that the document covers

commit and then we run normal maven release process, documentation releases will follow a typical 1.0 release approach, releasing before jetty releases so we can ship the latest version of these documents
we can consume the documentation from maven central while building out our distributions
we can also bundle up the html and deploy it to download.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation
we can provide links to older releases of the documentation
